title: Santander launches lowest mortgage rate for two years: is this the last chance to grab a cheap deal?
text:
One of the country’s biggest mortgage lenders has unveiled the cheapest two-year fixed-rate loan seen since 2017.

High street brand Santander has launched a 1.15pc deal for customers looking to switch their loan to the bank.

Rachel Springall of Moneyfacts, the data provider, said this rate was lower than both the 1.19pc two-year fix offered by NatWest and the 1.21pc sold by Barclays.

The analyst said this was the cheapest deal on the market since Nov 2017, when Atom Bank and Hanley Economic Building Society offered two-year fixes for 1.09pc.

However, there are heavy restrictions on who can apply for the Santander mortgage. The loan is only available to customers who are remortgaging their home...
description: One of the country’s biggest mortgage lenders has unveiled the cheapest two-year fixed-rate loan seen since 2017.
